cyclone.name: MARIA
cyclone.current_location: about 755 miles ESE of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: moving west, forecast to slow and turn WNW toward the Leeward Islands and the northeastern Caribbean (including the U.S. and British Virgin Islands) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Leeward Islands (near Dominica/Guadeloupe) Monday night–early Tuesday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for St. Lucia, Martinique, Guadeloupe and Dominica
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northern Lesser Antilles, including U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico expected mid-week
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm–force winds possible by early Wednesday; hurricane-force winds cannot be ruled out if intensification continues
weather_observation.storm_surge: None specified in current advisory for St. Croix
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 5–10 inches of rain with locally higher amounts producing flash flooding and mudslides
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning Tuesday night
